details.title: Shivraj Singh Chouhan to fight Congress' Arun Yadav for high-profile Budhni constituency
details.content: Two most prominent self-proclaimed 'farmer-sons' Shivraj Singh Chouhan and former Madhya Pradesh Congress chief Arun Yadav are pitted against each other in the high-profile Budhni seat from where the present chief minister contested his first assembly election in 1989-90.

details.title: Polling to begin shortly
details.content:
Visuals from a polling station in Bhopal. Polling for 227 constituencies in the state will begin at 8 am, while voting for 3 constituencies has already begun. #MadhyaPradeshElections2018 pic.twitter.com/RnjsoctPbV

— ANI (@ANI) November 28, 2018

details.title: Will Madhya Pradesh election be the key to seal BJP's fate in 2019?
details.content:
Of all the five election-bound states, Madhya Pradesh excites the most. The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) is not a significant factor in Mizoram, Telangana and Andhra Pradesh.

Chhattisgarh is perceived to be less significant while a possible change of government in Rajasthan would be a routine affair, leaving the electoral outcome in MP as the ultimate marker of gauging people’s mood with respect to the 2019 Lok Sabha elections.

(CLICK HERE TO READ MORE)

details.title: WATCH| All you need to know about Madhya Pradesh Elections
BJP President Amit Shah asks people to turnout in record numbers
details.content:
विकास...साफ नीयत, नीति और नेतृत्व से आता है।
आज मध्य प्रदेश जिस विकासपथ पर अग्रसर है उसमें सबसे बड़ा योगदान जनता द्वारा गत 15वर्षों में सही नेतृत्व का चुनाव है।

मैं सभी मतदाताओं से अपील करता हूँ कि अधिक से अधिक संख्या में मतदान कर विकसित मध्य प्रदेश को समृद्ध मध्य प्रदेश बनायें।

— Amit Shah (@AmitShah) November 28, 2018

details.title: Shivraj Singh Chouhan urges people of MP to celebrate their electoral franchise
details.content:
आज मतदान दिवस है। आप सभी सुबह पहले मतदान करें, फिर कोई दूसरा काम। अपने नागरिक अधिकार का उपयोग करने सभी परिजन, मित्र, पड़ोसी एक साथ जाएं। मताधिकार का उपयोग कर अन्य लोगों को भी प्रेरित करें। मतदान हमारा अधिकार ही नहीं, बल्कि महत्वपूर्ण जिम्मेदारी भी है।

— ShivrajSingh Chouhan (@ChouhanShivraj) November 28, 2018

details.title: 17,000 critical polling stations under surveillance
details.content: Around 17,000 polling stations have been categorised as critical, where peaceful polling will be ensured through heightened security measures such as webcasting, CCTV camera surveillance and a higher deployment of central security forces and micro observers.

details.title: BJP robbing people of MP for long time: Kamal Nath
details.content: I have full faith in the people of Madhya Pradesh, they are simple and innocent people who have been robbed for a long time by BJP, says Congress leader Kamal Nath.

details.title: Minister Yashodhara Raje Scindia casts her vote
details.content:
Madhya Pradesh Minister Yashodhara Raje Scindia casts her vote at a polling station in Shivpuri. She is up against Congress' Siddharth Lada. #MadhyaPradeshElections2018 pic.twitter.com/FrpyOXfZ7m

— ANI (@ANI) November 28, 2018

details.title: PM Modi urges people to celebrate their electoral rights
details.content:
आज मध्य प्रदेश में मतदान का दिन है। प्रदेश के सभी मतदाताओं से मेरा आग्रह है कि वे पूरे उत्साह के साथ लोकतंत्र के महापर्व में भाग लें और भारी संख्या में मतदान करें।

— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) November 28, 2018

details.title: Computer Baba hits refresh, suports Congress in Madhya Pradesh
details.content:
Narmade Sansad, a congregation of Hindu seers led by Namdev Das Tyagi alias Computer Baba in Jabalpur announced its support for the opposition Congress.

The Sansad, while making the announcement, also cautioned the Congress that the support was only for five years and if the party didn’t further the cause of the Hindu religion and the river Narmada after coming to power, it will also be uprooted after five years.

details.title: EVM malfunctioning reported from multiple constituencies
details.content:
EVM malfunctioning reported from multiple polling booths in Mhow and Depalpur seats of Indore district, Jabalpur Cant seat of Jabalpur district and Alirajpur district.

R The EVMs in Berasiya constituency of Bhopal are also facing technical glitches.

details.title: KK Mishra questions multiple EVM malfunctioning, call is bigger conspiracy
details.content: Congress leader KK Mishra on EVM malfunctioning "is it just technical snags or something more, may be part of some bigger conspiracy".

#MIZORAM: Many Bru voters turn up at Kanhmun Temporary PS.

details.title: Shivraj Singh Chauhan 100% sure of his fourth term
details.content: We’re 100 per cent certain that BJP will form government with an absolute majority. We have set a target of 200 seats and our lakhs of volunteers are working to make it a reality: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chauhan after casting his vote in Budhni.

details.title: Police seizes campaign material from BJP's polling agents from a polling booth in Bhopal
WATCH| Shivraj Singh Chauhan speaks to media after casting his vote
details.content:
#MadhyaPradeshElections2018 is not about electing a single MLA, it's about the holistic development of the state: Shivraj Singh Chauhan after casting his vote in Budhni.
LIVE: https://t.co/FXGTVPDHkg pic.twitter.com/yG33ZIKDM1

Former CM and opposition Mizo National Front (MNF) chief Zoramthanga cast his vote at Ramhlun polling booth in Aizawl North-II constituency.
Former CM and opposition Mizo National Front (MNF) chief Zoramthanga cast his vote at Ramhlun polling booth in Aizawl North-II constituency.

details.title: 6.32 percent polling till 9 am
details.content: The first hour of polling in Madhya Pradesh witnessed 6.32 per cent voters turn out.

details.title: 3 state government employees pass away on duty
details.content: Three state government employees deployed on poll duty died of heart attack in Indore and Gina districts this morning. Two died on duty at polling booths in Indore and a special police officer died at polling booth in Bamori constituency in Guna district.

details.title: Cases of Election code violation registered in 30 constituencies
details.content: Incidents of violation of model code of conduct recorded from over 30 constituencies since Tuesday night. Liquor, cash and freebies were distribution among voters.

details.title: 111-year-old woman exercises her electoral franchise
details.content: 111-year-old Doli Bai votes in Guna district (Photo| EPS)

details.title: 101-year-old woman braves it out
details.content:
#MadhyaPradeshElections2018 | Centurion voter, 101-year-old Bhagwati Vyas votes in Nalkheda polling booth in Agar-Makwa district.
Express video: Anuraag Singh
LIVE: https://t.co/FXGTVPDHkg pic.twitter.com/0AIG069ovp

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) November 28, 2018

details.title: 15.58 % polling recorded till 11.15 am
details.content: 15.58 per cent polling has been recorded through out the state til 11.15 am. Maximum 27% polling in Sagar district while 2.53% polling recorded in Alirajpur district.

details.title: Dalit voters allegedly beaten by miscreants on Tuesday night
details.content: Dalit voters were allegedly beaten up and held captive by unknown miscreants in home minister Bhupebdra Singh's constituency Khurai in Sagar district on Tuesday night. A motorbike was also set ablaze.

details.title: Kamal Nath in soup for flashing palm after voting at a polling booth in Chhindwara district
details.content: The Bharatiya Janata Party filed a complaint with the Election Commission (EC) after Congress leader Kamal Nath was seen flashing his palm after voting at a polling booth in Chhindwara district. Following the complaint, EC takes has ordered a probe into the matter.

details.title: Rs 10 lakh ex-gratia for kin of poll officers who passed away on duty
details.content: Election Commission announces Rs 10 lakh each compensation for the kin of the EC officials who passed away while on election duty. (ANI)

details.title: 200 EVMs replaced across 230 constituencies
details.content: Election Commission recieves over140 complaints of EVM malfunctioning and other irregularities in first two hours of polling. Over 200 EVMs replaced across the state.

details.title: Violence reported at several constituencies in Bhind district
details.content:
Multiple bouts of violence have been reported from Bhind district. Samajwadi Party candidate's supporters indulge in firing to intimidate voters outside polling booths at Bhind Janpad Panchayat in Bhind assembly seat.

In Lahar constiuency, anti social elements stormed into polling booth and damaged the EVM. The government official vehicle was also vandalised. BJP polling agent and three others were attacked allegedly by Congress workers outside polling booth in Rama village of Water constituency.

details.title: Congress leader Jyotiraditya Scindia after voting in Gwalior
25.25 percent voting recorded till 1pm across Madhya Pradesh
details.content: 25.25 per cent voting has been recorded across the state till 1 pm. Umaria saw the highest tunout of 36.36 percent and Sidhi lowest at 18.55.

details.title: Here are all the high profile candidates
Kamal Nath hits back at BJP's allegation on violating Election code of conduct
details.content: I had already cast my vote. When people asked me whom I have voted for I showed this (palm). What else could have I done?Show a lotus?: Kamal Nath

details.title: TV Actor Divyanka Tripathi Dahiya at a polling booth in hometown Bhopal
37.29% voters turn out recorded till 2.30 pm
details.content: A turn out of 37.29 per cent voters was recorded across 230 constituencies. Maximum turnout was recorded in Raised at 48.3 per cent and minimum 30.12 per cent in Mandasur.

details.title: Shivraj Singh Chouhan condoles death of three polling officers
details.content:
विधानसभा चुनाव की ड्यूटी के दौरान अधिकारियों की मृत्यु की खबर से मन दुखी है। दिवंगत आत्माओं को सादर श्रद्धांजलि। पीड़ित परिवारों के प्रति शोक संवेदनाएं प्रकट करता हूं। पीड़ा की इस घड़ी में हम सभी आपके साथ हैं।

— ShivrajSingh Chouhan (@ChouhanShivraj) November 28, 2018

details.title: Three held for firing outside polling booth in Bhind
details.content: Three people have been arrested for allegedly firing outside a polling booth in Bhind Assembly constituency.

details.title: Over 700 EVMs replaced across 230 constituencies
details.content: As of now 745 EVMs and Voter Verifiable Paper Audit Trail machines have been replaced across the state.

details.title: 55% polling recorded till 4 pm
details.content: Amidst multiple bouts of violence and EVM malfunctioning, the state of Madhya Pradesh witnessed voter turn out of 55 per cent.
